abstract: An economist writes about the claim that chief executives’ pay has soared in recent years because C.E.O.’s have figured out how to game the corporate compensation system.
snippet: An economist writes about the claim that chief executives’ pay has soared in recent years because C.E.O.’s have figured out how to game the corporate compensation system.
lead_paragraph: 5/18/10 | Updated to correct Kevin Murphy’s affiliation
